page.title: 02FARMING LAND AT APPLEBY
page.content:
This is an area of{arable farming- the only livestock farming being pigs.
The westerly side of{Ermine Street is limestone land suited to a variety of crops including potatoes and sugar beet, wereas the Ancholme valley in the east is heavy clay unsuitable for root crops but particularly good for wheat, peas and oil seed rape.
Most of the Ancholme valley land is underdrained with tiled systems which are drained to a pumping station where two electric pumps deliver the water into the{River Ancholme.}The water flows along to Ferriby where doors control a gravity flow into the{River{ {Humber}at low water.
